snippet: Russia’s government-operated networks are led by executives who have helped promote President Vladimir V. Putin’s agenda, but they are facing fact-checking over coverage of Ukraine.
abstract: Russian television broadcasts of crisis in Ukraine are a mixture of legitimate perspectives, half-truths and outright propaganda, but government-operated networks are facing fact-checking over coverage.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from Moscow, and Ravi Somaiya from New York.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s government-operated networks are led by executives who have helped promote President Vladimir V. Putin’s agenda, but they are facing fact-checking over coverage of Ukraine.

headline.main: For Russian TV Channels, Influence and Criticism
headline.print_headline: For Russian TV Channels, Influence and Criticism
